result.execSummary:
The defendant John David Myrick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $2,345 payable to Zara Food Market. 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
- Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection from any court ordered obilgations from the defendant's prison funds in an amount or percentage determined by DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Concurrent with: with 337 DAYS credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: - No contact with Zara Food Market.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John David Myrick

records.addlTxt: Received & Filed, Original PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (22 pages) commencing 12/12/2016 by MARILYN ANNEN.
Converted at request of court reporter Marilyn Annen.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  4 YEARS with 337 DAYS credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and/or the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No contact with: Zara Food Market.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $2,345 payable to Zara Food Market. 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
- Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection from any court ordered obilgations from the defendant's prison funds in an amount or percentage determined by DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

20 day appeal rights given,

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes her plea to GUILTY. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, ammunition or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Case is proceeded to sentencing in Branch 7.

Attorney Parker Charles Mathers in court, defendant John David Myrick not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AS. Case calendared for jury trial. For reasons stated on the record case passed.

Case recalled.

Attorney Parker Charles Mathers in court, defendant John David Myrick in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AS. Case proceeded to plea hearing.

Attorney Parker Charles Mathers in court, defendant John David Myrick not in court, in custody.  alex mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case still in trial posture.

Defendant John David Myrick in court with attorney Parker Charles Mathers.  Defendant John David Myrick in custody.  Andrea Fendry supervised by Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense was going to proceed with a plea, however, at this time defense counsel is unable to proceed.  Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2016 at 09:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.
received and filed from the defendant.

Attorney Parker Charles Mathers in court, defendant John David Myrick not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was produced from RCI and now informs counsel that he does not wish to resolve on today's date and wants a trial date.    All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2016 this case will be assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 7,  in Room 629 of the Courthouse.  Case adjourned to 10-3-2016 for jury trial.  Jury trial scheduled for October 3, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Parker Charles Mathers in court, defendant John David Myrick not in court, in custody at Racine Correctional.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting a plea/sentencing date of 7-25-2016.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 25, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Parker Charles Mathers in court, defendant John David Myrick not in court, in custody at Dodge Correctional.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel is newly appointed and has not had the chance to review discovery or meet with defendant.  Court will set for pretrial on 6-27-2016.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 27, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant John David Myrick in court with attorney James T Moczydlowski.  Defendant John David Myrick in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Motion Hearing.  Defense has conflict.  Defense motion to withdraw heard and granted by the Court.  
Attorney Moczydlowski to inform the Public Defender's Office of the need for appointment of counsel.
Case set for status of counsel before Branch 38.  Status conference scheduled for June 13, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Dodge Correctional.
to Withdraw as Attorney of Record filed.  Motion set for 6-1-2016; defendant to be produced.  State advised of date.

Attorney James T Moczydlowski in court, defendant John David Myrick not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Defense Attorney was just appointed. Defense requested additional time to review the file and discuss with the defendant. Court grants request. Case calendared for Scheduling Conference on 6/1/2016 at 8:15 a.m. in Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant John David Myrick in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant John David Myrick in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case set for Final Pretrial. Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court. Defendant referred to State Public Defender. Attorney McGinn to advise appointment secretary. Clerk sent email to Public Defender's Office to request attorney appointment.  Case calendared for Status of Counsel on 5/11/2016 at 8:15 a.m. in Branch 38.  Status conference scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Motion to Withdraw as Counsel filed

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant John David Myrick not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Revocation hearing is set for 3-1-2016.  Case set for final pretrial on 4-26-2016 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 5-11-2016 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 3-25-2016.  ls  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant John David Myrick not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense waived the defendant's appearance for this hearing. Branch 25 is in trial and unable to hear this matter. Defense counsel advised the court the defendant's revocation hearing has not been scheduled yet. Court will allow one adjournment pending the scheduling of the revocation hearing. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant John David Myrick in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant John David Myrick in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Lafayette Emmons-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with RS or 1955 N 32nd Street

Defendant John David Myrick in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant John David Myrick in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
